subject: Economics
title: Global Inequality: The Lottery of Birth
description: A 60-second lesson on Global Inequality: The Lottery of Birth.

hook.text: Where you're born determines 60% of your lifetime income. Your talent, effort, and choices control the other 40%.

buildup.text: An average American earns $65,000/year. An average Congolese earns $500. Same species, same planet, 130x income gap.

discovery.text: Branko Milanovic showed that between-country inequality is far larger than within-country inequality.

twist.text: A poor person in the US is richer than 85% of humanity. Poverty is relative within countries but absolute across them.

climax.text: Global inequality is fundamentally a question of borders.

punchline.text: Your biggest economic advantage isn't your degree. It's your passport.

quiz.question: What determines the largest share of a person's lifetime income?
